incidents.name: Decrease in Delivery Receipts (DLRs) for RCS Messages

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing a decrease in delivery receipts (DLRs) for RCS (Rich Communication Services) messages. This incident has been resolved, and Verify fallback to SMS is now operating as expected.

We are currently investigating a decrease in delivery receipts (DLRs) for RCS (Rich Communication Services) messages. Our engineering teams are actively working to identify the root cause and restore normal delivery performance as quickly as possible. Customers may experience Verify unable to perform any fallback to SMS.

We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: High Error Rates for Conversations and Programmable Video in IE1

incident_updates.body: "404" errors from Cloudfront for Conversation API calls or increased error rates when trying to connect to Video Rooms has been resolved and programmable video is operating normally at this time.

Due to a third party provider, Conversations and Programmable Video were degraded between 7:53 AM to 9:28 AM Pacific Time on 01/28/2026. During this period, customers may have experienced "404" errors from Cloudfront for Conversation API calls or increased error rates when trying to connect to Video Rooms. The issue has been mitigated, but we are continuing to monitor. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to a third party provider, Conversations and Programmable Video were degraded between 7:53 AM to 9:28 AM Pacific Time on 01/28/2026. During this period, customers may have experienced "404" errors from Cloudfront for Conversation API calls or increased error rates when trying to connect to Video Rooms. The issue has been mitigated, but we are continuing to monitor. We'll provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Emergency Number Provisioning Failing Intermittently Due to Configuration Lookup Returning No Results

incident_updates.body: We continue investigating an intermittent issue:when the customer attempts to register an emergency address to a phone number the registration fails and the number remains in an unregistered status. Customer may also see Could not add Emergency Address Please try again later error. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue investigating an intermittent issue when the customer attempts to register an emergency address to a phone number the registration fails and the number remains in an unregistered status. Customer may also see Could not add Emergency Address Please try again later error. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue investigating an intermittent issue when the customer attempts to register an emergency address to a phone number the registration fails and the number remains in an unregistered status. Customer may also see Could not add Emergency Address Please try again later error. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Intermittent issue when the customer attempts to register an emergency address to a phone number the registration fails and the number remains in an unregistered status. Customer may also see Could not add Emergency Address Please try again later error. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with emergency number provisioning. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Sync Platform and Conversations Affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio Sync Platform and Conversations were degraded between 7:53 AM to 9:22 AM Pacific Time on 01/28/2026. During this period of time customers may have experienced delay in webhooks related to sync object mutations (add, delete, edit) and 404 from Cloudfront in IE1 for any public api calls. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Verify OTP Email Message Delivery Delays Impacting Gmail

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing delays in Verify Email OTP delivery for messages sent via SendGrid, primarily which was impacting Gmail recipients. This incident has been resolved.

We continue experiencing delays in Verify Email OTP delivery for messages sent via SendGrid, primarily impacting Gmail recipients. This behavior is due to an ongoing issue on the Gmail side, and we are actively monitoring with Google.

Our engineering team continues to track this closely in coordination with SendGrid. We expect to provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still experiencing delays in Verify Email OTP delivery for messages sent via SendGrid, primarily impacting Gmail recipients. This behavior is due to an ongoing issue on the Gmail side, and we are actively monitoring with Google.

Our engineering team continues to track this closely in coordination with SendGrid. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified that the Verify OTP email delivery delays are related to an ongoing issue impacting Gmail delivery on our email provider, SendGrid.
Emails are being successfully accepted by Gmail's mail servers; however, Gmail is currently experiencing delays in delivering messages to recipient inboxes. Other email providers are not affected.
Our teams are actively monitoring the situation and coordinating with SendGrid as they continue to track updates from Google. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected Verify OTP email message delivery delays since 5:00 AM PT. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: [Programmable SMS] SMS Delivery to Claro Network in Costa Rica Affected

incidents.name: WhatsApp outbound messages may be Delayed

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Whatsapp. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery in SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Whatsapp. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending outbound messages to to Whatsapp. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
